instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0239: What is 820-0239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Came in for Battery Replacement a few months ago. Customer opted for a chinese knock off battery.

Came in today again as dead.
Tried another battery and it was working.
Its not reading a battery from china but working on a pulled out battery.

On the pulled out battery too it has a problem.

It turns on and works well but once we put the flap down and put it to sleep. It wont turn on again. Have to disconnect and re connect battery.

No Corrosion on the board.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
One lid sensor is bad; probably corroded.
Inspect J5250/60.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: They both look okay to me. What readings do you want ?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and also <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT, with lid open/closed.
Find proper test points.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I think its a battery issue. Its turning on without a battery but not when battery connected.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Hi, Please help me out here.
